title.narrative: BUILDING PARTNERSHIP WITH CIVIL SOCIETY

description.narrative: By the end of 2015, civil society organizations, including self-representational groups, effectively mobilize demand for and access to entitlements, influence behavioural change and participate in local decision-making bodies to facilitate social inclusion., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2015, Serbia's child rights infrastructure will be strengthened and civic and private engagement enhanced to realize children's rights

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2015, civil society organizations, including self-representational groups, effectively mobilize demand for and accessto entitlements, influence behavioural change and participate in local decision-making bodies to facilitate social inclusion.

Number of annual initiatives by CSO coalitions taking action on relevant topics for improving child rights (reducing violence among adolescents and youth, child poverty, discrimination, inclusive education) with national and social media coverage

actual.value: 2015:2 initiatives: 1) MODS and the Network of CSOs for women's submitted to the government initiative to access EU Program Rights, Equality and Citizenship - REC aimed at advancing human rights and equity, 2) in cooperation with the regional coalition of networks Child Pact, MODS participated in develop

title.narrative: % of poor who are not receiving MOP due to lack of information on availability of MOP and application procedures

actual.value: 2015:26% This percentage includes poor respondents who didn't apply for FSA (MOP) because they were unaware of the program, did not know how to apply or because application procedures were too complicated

title.narrative: % of boys and girls from vulnerable groups not going to preschool because of parental attitudes

target.value: 2015:30% increase in attendance of preschool education by boys and girls from vulnerable groups
